intro: Encyclia bicornuta, commonly known as the two-horned orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its erect, leafy stems and produces showy, fragrant flowers with a distinctive two-horned structure on the lip. The plant typically blooms in the summer, with flowers ranging in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Encyclia bicornuta is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
